resume.coverLetter:
Hi my name is Yann.
I would like to apply for the position of dishwasher, line and prep cook. 

I'm a hard worker punctual, determined and competitive who loves and always ready to learn. 
Over seven Year's experience in kitchens with certificate in healt and food safety 
Speaks English and French, it would be a pleasure to work with you and your team.

I'm available anytime

Please you are interested write me on my email at yann.letarte-lavoie@outlook.com or call me at (5148307191)
Thank you and have a good day.

resume.rawText:
James Clerke

0413842504 jamesclerke@hotmail.com 8 Stockmans Drive, Moonee Beach, NSW




Objective
I plan to move to Canada for the remainder of the 2015/16 winter season and wish to further my career as a chef, expand my knowledge, enhance my skills, build strong networks in the ski industry and have some time in the mountains.

Experience
CHEF, SKI RIDER HOTEL,JINDABYNE- JUNE-OCTOBER 2015
* At Ski Rider I was responsible for two breakfasts shifts a week, catering for 200-350
guests.

* I also worked six afternoon/night shifts a week mainly preparing meat cuts for our grill service, as well as salads and hot food for a buffet style/grill service.

SOUS CHEF, OLD JOHNS CAFE'/BAR, COFFS HARBOUR- JULY 2014- MAY 2015
* As a Sous Chef at Old Johns I have taken on all aspects of kitchen management
Including assisting in menu planning, writing and costing, rostering, implementing cleaning plans and rosters, training of kitchen and front of house staff, stock ordering receiving and storing and preparation and cooking of all meals.

CHEF, PINNACLE PEOPLE, BRISBANE - JAN-MAY 2014
* In this position I worked as a temp chef locally in Brisbane and around the state of Queensland.

* The Highlight of this job was filling a Chef de Partie position on Heron Island in the resort for a two month period.

PASTRY COOK/DELIVERY DRIVER, K'PANE ARTISAN BAKERY, COFFS HARBOUR-DEC 2010-DEC 2013
* I was initially delivering bread and pastries as a second job. After a few months my responsibilities extended into cooking and preparing pastry and filling in for front of house, serving our products and making coffee.

* As a wholesale bakery my other responsibilities included taking orders and invoicing (using MYOB Software).

CHEF, LAKISS JETTY PIZZERIA, COFFS HARBOUR - DEC 2010-JUN 2013
* In this role I cooked main meals, pizza and was responsible for prep and ordering.

* Other jobs Included serving customers and training staff.
APPRENTICE/ HEAD CHEF, PICCOLO RESTAURANT,COFFS HARBOUR - DEC 2006-SEP 2010
* I proceeded to this role as an Apprentice after working at Foreshores Cafe' under the same owner and moved on to become Head Chef at the end of my apprenticeship.

* As an Apprentice I had the opportunity to work closely with the Head Chef obtaining the Knowledge and skill to be able to run the kitchen in his absence.

* Responsibilities included general kitchen management, preparation, cooking and service of all meals, stock ordering receiving and storage, training an apprentice, kitchen hand, and front of house staff, taking reservations and general cleanliness/ hygiene of the premises.

APPRENTICE CHEF, FORESHORES CAFE, COFFS HARBOUR - DEC 2006-FEB 2007
* I began my apprenticeship here, responsibilities included were to prepare, cook and serve cafe meals, washing dishes and cleaning.




Education and Qualifications
Certificate III in hospitality (Commercial Cookery) @ Tafe North Coast Institute 2009

Responsibility of Alcohol @ Tafe North Coast institute 2009

School Certificate @ John Paul College, Coffs Harbour 2006

Drivers Licence (Classes C and R)




Skills
* Committed to Quality and Consistency.

* An Italian a la Carte background with a "from scratch" approach.

* Highly adaptive and versatile in the workplace.

* Ability to create and implement training.

* Thorough understanding of kitchen hygiene.

* Experience with functions and bulk cooking.
* Customer service and retail experience.

* Basic knowledge of MYOB software.

* Exceptional communication skills.

* Bar experience.

* Knowledge and Experience with Pastry and Bread.

References


Jock Fraser Old Johns Cafe/Bar

Head Chef

* 0413875438



Paul & Katie Lakiss Lakiss Jetty Pizzeria

Previous Employers

* 043187477



Brett & Kirsty Knight K'pane Artisan Bakery

Previous Employers

* 0437613533 (02) 66580 085



Malcolm Bendrey Virgin Australia

Former Head Chef (Piccolo Restaurant)

* 0431911393

resume.coverLetter:
James Clerke
8 Stockmans Drive 
Moonee Beach  NSW
Australia
530-540-8940
jamesclerke@hotmail.com

2 February 2016
Mark Wiegele Helicopter Skiing 

Dear Sir/Madam
This letter is to introduce myself and let you know of my interest in joining your team in the position of Line Cook as advertised.

I am currently travelling in the United States and will arrive in Canada later this month, my working visa application has been approved.
The enclosed resume will supply you with information on my employment history, training and skills. I can assure you any task I am given will be performed with a high degree of professionalism and skill.

Throughout my career I have had the opportunity to work with some very skilful, knowledgeable and respectable mentors, working along side them enabled me to become calm and collected in a fast paced environment and also incredibly efficient.
My initial training took place in an a' la carte restaurant in which I moved on to become head chef, at Piccolo we took a “from scratch” approach to all of our meals, this has given me the knowledge and skill to become more refined and creative in the industry.

My passion for food, travel and winter sports, along with a love of like minded people keeps me extremely motivated,
I recently finished a winter season in Australia filling a seemingly similar position therefore I believe I would adapt quite quickly and be an integral part of your team.

I am able to start In late February, Please don't hesitate to contact me for any further information.

Sincerely yours,

James Clerke

experience.description:
* At Ski Rider I was responsible for two breakfasts shifts a week, catering for 200-350
guests.
* I also worked six afternoon/night shifts a week mainly preparing meat cuts for our grill service, as well as salads and hot food for a buffet style/grill service.

* As a Sous Chef at Old Johns I have taken on all aspects of kitchen management
Including assisting in menu planning, writing and costing, rostering, implementing cleaning plans and rosters, training of kitchen and front of house staff, stock ordering receiving and storing and preparation and cooking of all meals.

* In this position I worked as a temp chef locally in Brisbane and around the state of Queensland.
* The Highlight of this job was filling a Chef de Partie position on Heron Island in the resort for a two month period.

* I was initially delivering bread and pastries as a second job. After a few months my responsibilities extended into cooking and preparing pastry and filling in for front of house, serving our products and making coffee.
* As a wholesale bakery my other responsibilities included taking orders and invoicing (using MYOB Software).

* In this role I cooked main meals, pizza and was responsible for prep and ordering.
* Other jobs Included serving customers and training staff.

* I proceeded to this role as an Apprentice after working at Foreshores Cafe' under the same owner and moved on to become Head Chef at the end of my apprenticeship.
* As an Apprentice I had the opportunity to work closely with the Head Chef obtaining the Knowledge and skill to be able to run the kitchen in his absence.
* Responsibilities included general kitchen management, preparation, cooking and service of all meals, stock ordering receiving and storage, training an apprentice, kitchen hand, and front of house staff, taking reservations and general cleanliness/ hygiene of the premises.
* I began my apprenticeship here, responsibilities included were to prepare, cook and serve cafe meals, washing dishes and cleaning.

Including assisting in menu planning, writing and costing, rostering, implementing cleaning plans and rosters, training of kitchen and front of house staff, stock ordering receiving and storing and preparation and cooking of all meals.

* In this position I worked as a temp chef locally in Brisbane and around the state of Queensland.
* The Highlight of this job was filling a Chef de Partie position on Heron Island in the resort for a two month period.

questions.answered: I am extremely passionate about snowboarding, food and travel My goal this year in Canada is to create strong networks in the industry so that I may return next season and maybe in years to come.
I would expect no more than the advertised wage.

I hold a Certificate of Proficiency In Cookery (Western), This is an Australian Trade Certificate
Also Certificate III in Hospitality (Commercial Cookery)

Professional catering experiences




Employment goal : I have several years of experience in catering, both in cooking and taking orders. I have a degree and many years of experience in pastry and chocolate making, and also have a basic knowledge in baking.
Also worked as seasonal, and so I have many years of experience in fruit picking, mushroom picking and farming. I also have some experience in inside and outside painting as well as housekeeping or construction building cleaning.
After few years farming I've now got the desire to go back to my kitchen side, which I never left you will see below, staying, at the same time, as close as possible from the wilderness. Looking for long term position or seasonal, full or part-time.
I have my own vehicle.
So I would like to join your team to develop my abilities and to put my experience to good use. And, more of being dynamic and multi-task, I am a skillful and hard working person.
CHOCOLATE MAKER and PASTRY CHEF
Sweet Turtle, My own company since 2010 which I open back every winter to create and sell chocolates and pastries to different restaurants and privates. France 2015-2016
British Columbia 2013-2015
Quebec 2010-2012

* Hand molding of the chocolate (from the little candy chocolates to the big Easter Rabbit)

* Maintain of the material and cleaning
* Opening and closing the shop, inventory

* Dough and paste preparation and cooking (cookies, muffins, cake, sponge etc.)
* Work dough and detail the various viennoiseries
* Cakes decoration

* Meals preparation and cooking
* Packaging, labelling and displaying
* Maintain of the material and cleaning
* Opening and closing the shop, inventory
 
* BAKER APPRENTICE							          2011-2012
* L'Amour du Pain, Boucherville, QC
* Weigh ingredients for the various dough
* Shape, with hands or shaper, various bread, baguettes, brioches etc.

* Preparation of the salt range (breads et pizzas)
* Displaying
* Maintain of the material and cleaning

* Preparation (cook and assembly) of the ordered plates

*

resume.coverLetter:
After few years farming I've now got the desire to go back to my kitchen side, which I never left you will see below, staying, at the same time, as close as possible from the wilderness. Looking for long term position or seasonal, full or part-time. Able to work any kind of shift.
I have my own vehicle and a little trailer which is my very own tiny house.
So I would like to join your team to develop my abilities and to put my experience to good use. And, more of being dynamic and multi-task, I am a skillful and hard working person.

questions.answered: I like remote area close from the wilderness.
Depending of the work I be asked, from 14$ to 18$ an hour.
I worked in kitchen for several years (as a helper and as chef), I have as well a Degree in Pastry and Chocolate making.

* Chocolate working (candies, decoration, tinning)
* Meals preparation and cooking
* Packaging, labelling and displaying
* Maintain of the material and cleaning
* Opening and closing the shop, inventory

* Weigh ingredients for the various dough
* Shape, with hands or shaper, various bread, baguettes, brioches etc.
* Manage viennoiserie cooking
* Preparation of the salt range (breads et pizzas)
* Displaying
* Maintain of the material and cleaning
* For a description of the work, see the previous Pastrier description

*      Be aware of the recipes linked to the shop
*      Sandwich preparation (bread, wrap, panini) and salads
*      Organize the shop
*      Organize the kitchen and cleaning (shop and material)
* For a description of the work, see the description below.

* Create the daily menu in function of the available ingredients
* Making the desserts
* Prepare, season, condition and cook with appropriate methods  (meats, vegetables and salads)
* Preparation (cook and assembly) of the ordered plates
* Dishwashing and kitchen cleaning
* Host, inform and serve customers, at the counter or in the room
* Cashier
* Opening and closing of the restaurant
*
*
*
* Note : As Chocolate Maker I have all my tools and molds with me, from Christmas theme to Easter going through regular and casual candy chocolates for the ones I have lots of molds as well.
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
Seasonal worker experience (references on demand)
(ORGANIC FARMING, Stoney Paradise Orchard, Kelowna, BC           Autumn      2015
FRUIT PICKING, Okanagan Valley, BC	                Summer and Autumn  2012 to 2016
MUSHROOM PICKING, Tofino and Uclelet, BC			          Autumn       2012
FARMING, Vantreight Farm, Victoria, BC				          Winter         2012
Working with UNLIMITED LABOUR, Vancouver, BC                          Winter         2012
*
*
*

questions.answered: I like remote area close from the wilderness.
Depending of the work I be asked, from 14$ to 18$ an hour.
I worked in kitchen for several years (as a helper and as chef), I have as well a Degree in Pastry and Chocolate making.

resume.coverLetter:
Nidhin Zachariah Koshy,
804, Hoover Street,
Nelson, BC –V1L 4X5 

February 4, 2016

Katherine Lamb
Human Resources Manager,
Mike Wiegele Helicopter Skiing,  
Blue River, BC, 
CANADA - V0E 1J0

Dear Katherine,

Re: Co-op and Summer Internship placement

It’s with great joy that I am applying for the post of line cook at the Mike Wiegele Helicopter Skiing. I have always envisioned the responsibilities and joy of being a cook. My past experience will surely be a value addition to this post and its responsibilities. 

I have worked in the kitchen sector as a steward and dishwasher for four years ensuring that all the day to day responsibilities are carried out with perfection. Even though I have completed a degree in Computer Science Engineering, I worked part-time as a kitchen steward during this time. From that time, I became passionate about working in a fast kitchen environment. I am very much aware of the hygiene and proper storage of produce, meats and dairy products. I am very excited about my work term because my post-graduate studies in Hospitality Management at Selkirk College will be completed by April, 2016 and I hope to continue working for the Mike Wiegele Helicopter Skiing after my work term. I consider this is my best chance to work in a fast paced kitchen.

I am sure this work experience as a cook will be a new learning opportunity for me. To take this forward I would very much love to talk with you and discuss a possible way forward. If you have any concerns or want any further clarifications, please feel free to contact me at 250-687-4821 or email me at nidhinzachariahkos@edu.selkirk.ca


Thank you

Sincerely,


Nidhin Zachariah Koshy

questions.answered: I always like to be a part of a fast-paced working environment.When I came to know about your helicopter skiing company, I really wanted to be a part of your team because of the adventurous and challenging activities done there. the staff benefits offered by your company is also a part of my interest in your company.
$14-16 per hour with a full time employment
I have food safe level one and serving it right certification

job:
Mike Wiegele Helicopter Skiing is seeking a skilled individual to fill the position of Line Cook. The Line Cook preps and cooks food for guests, keeps the kitchen supplied, maintains clean lines, and assists the Head Chef as much as possible.

 

Qualifications

  • Two years experience in a similar position
  • Must be able to frequently bend and kneel, lift moderate weight, and work on feet for an extended period of time
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Ability to work independently
  • Willing to work a variety of day and weekend shifts
  • Attributes include energetic personality, punctuality, and good grooming standards
  • Foodsafe certification

 

Compensation: $14 – 15.50 per hour

 

Benefits of employment include

  • Subsidized staff accommodation in private room or residence at a cost of only $200 to $450 per month (depending on housing preference)
  • Fitness center
  • Staff rate for on-site massage therapy
  • Family and friends discounts
  • Opportunities to ski for free
  • Complementary recreation opportunities such as cross country skiing, snow shoeing, and hiking
  • Numerous volunteer opportunities within the community
  • Discounted rates at various hotels in Kamloops, Jasper and Vernon
  • Staff meal plan
  • 40 % off retail items in our world class boutique
  • Guaranteed adventure!
